Package org.lgdcloudsim.core

Class CloudSimTag

java.lang.Object
org.lgdcloudsim.core.CloudSimTag
public class CloudSimTag extends Object
Tags indicating a type of action that needs to be undertaken by CloudSim entities when they receive or send events. The lower the value of Tag, the higher the execution priority.
Since:
CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
Author:
Manzur Murshed, Rajkumar Buyya, Anthony Sulistio, Manoel Campos da Silva Filho, Anonymous

    • NONE

      public static final int NONE
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BASE

      private static final int BASE
      Starting constant value for cloud-related tags.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DC_REGISTRATION_REQUEST

      public static final int DC_REGISTRATION_REQUEST
      Denotes a request from a Datacenter to register itself. This tag is normally used between CloudInformationService and Datacenter entities. When such a SimEvent is sent, the SimEvent.getData() must be a Datacenter object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CHANGE_COLLABORATION_SYN

      public static final int CHANGE_COLLABORATION_SYN
      Periodically modify the scope of each collaboration zone. This tag is used to notify the CloudInformationService to change the collaboration zone.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • END_INSTANCE_RUN

      public static final int END_INSTANCE_RUN
      Denotes the end of the execution of instances. This tag is used by the Datacenter. the SimEvent.getData() must be a list of Instance objects which are finishing at the same time.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SYN_STATE_IN_DC

      public static final int SYN_STATE_IN_DC
      Synchronize host states to intra-scheduler in the data center. It will be executed periodically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SYN_STATE_BETWEEN_DC

      public static final int SYN_STATE_BETWEEN_DC
      Synchronize host states to inter-scheduler between data centers. It will be executed periodically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • USER_REQUEST_FAIL

      public static final int USER_REQUEST_FAIL
      Denotes that some user request has failed. This event will be sent to CloudInformationService for processing. The SimEvent.getData() must be a set of UserRequest object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DC_LIST_REQUEST

      public static final int DC_LIST_REQUEST
      Denotes a request from the UserSimple to a CloudInformationService to get the list of all Datacenters which are registered with the CloudInformationService.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • USER_REQUEST_SEND

      public static final int USER_REQUEST_SEND
      Denotes a request from the UserSimple to send. It can be sent to the CloudInformationService or to a Datacenter. The SimEvent.getData() must be a list of UserRequest object. It also can be the InterScheduler scheduling result. In this case, the instanceGroups can be forwarded to other data centers.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NEED_SEND_USER_REQUEST

      public static final int NEED_SEND_USER_REQUEST
      Denotes that there are still user requests that need to be sent by the UserSimple.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INTER_SCHEDULE_BEGIN

      public static final int INTER_SCHEDULE_BEGIN
      Denotes the start of inter-scheduler scheduling. Note that it must be bigger than USER_REQUEST_SEND. Therefore, when two events arrive at the same time, the user request can be placed in the queue first, and then inter-scheduler scheduling can be started.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INTER_SCHEDULE_END

      public static final int INTER_SCHEDULE_END
      Denotes the end of inter-scheduler scheduling. The event will be sent after the execution of the INTER_SCHEDULE_BEGIN. The time interval between two events is the time spent on inter-scheduling. The SimEvent.getData() must be a list of InterSchedulerResult object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SCHEDULE_TO_DC_NO_FORWARD

      public static final int SCHEDULE_TO_DC_NO_FORWARD
      Send the scheduling results of the InterScheduler to the data center. This type of scheduling only clarifies which data center the instance group is scheduled to and does not perform host-level scheduling on the instances in the instance group. After the instance group is sent to the data center, the data center does not allow the instance group to be forwarded to other data centers. So the datacenter will call intra-scheduler to schedule the instance group. The SimEvent.getData() must be a list of InstanceGroup object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST

      public static final int SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST
      Send the scheduling results of the InterScheduler to the data center. This type of scheduling not only clarifies which data center the instance group is scheduled to, but also schedules the instances in the instance group at the host level. The SimEvent.getData() must be a list of InstanceGroup object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST_OK

      public static final int SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST_OK
      This event is used to respond to the SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST event. It indicates that all instances included in the event were successfully scheduled to the host without conflicts and failures.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST_CONFLICTED

      public static final int SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST_CONFLICTED
      This event is used to respond to the SCHEDULE_TO_DC_HOST event. It indicates that there are conflicts or failures in scheduling the instances to the host. The SimEvent.getData() must be a FailedOutdatedResult<InstanceGroup> object.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LOAD_BALANCE_SEND

      public static final int LOAD_BALANCE_SEND
      Denotes the start of the load balancing process. It is used by the Datacenter. It will call the LoadBalancer to distribute the instances to the intra-schedulers.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INTRA_SCHEDULE_END

      public static final int INTRA_SCHEDULE_END
      Denotes the end of the IntraScheduler scheduling. The event will be sent after the execution of the INTRA_SCHEDULE_BEGIN.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PRE_ALLOCATE_RESOURCE

      public static final int PRE_ALLOCATE_RESOURCE
      Conflict checking before placing any instance on the host.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INTRA_SCHEDULE_BEGIN

      public static final int INTRA_SCHEDULE_BEGIN
      Denotes the start of the IntraScheduler scheduling.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • UNIQUE_TAG

      public static final Set<Integer> UNIQUE_TAG
      If there are multiple identical events at the same time, they only need to be executed once.

    • LOOP_TAG

      public static final Set<Integer> LOOP_TAG
      Tags that exist in cycles. If only these tags are left in all events, it means that there are no new events that need to be executed, and the simulation can be ended.
